citeinfo.title: NASA INCA CONUS Land Surface Phenology EVIarea Significant (p = 0.05) Theil-Sen slope magnitude
NASA-INCA CONUS Land Surface Phenology normals, anomalies, and trends

descript.abstract: Remotely sensed land surface phenology data are important for driving models and understanding how climatic variability influences ecosystem processes. The MODIS Land Cover Dynamics dataset (MCD12Q2) provides global, annual, 500 m resolution data describing the timing of key land surface phenology events from 2001-present. These products are available to the entire user community, but are delivered in hard to use file formats and unfamiliar geographic projections. Moreover, most end users are interested in derivative quantities such as the average arrival time of spring, in interannual anomalies, and in trends. Computing these quantities requires relatively high technical sophistication and computational abilities that make it infeasible for many users. We aimed to make the MCD12Q2 products more accessible and usable by providing the most requested, value-added derivative layers: phenometric normals (average, median, std. dev., and median absolute deviation), trends (Theil-Sen slope magnitude and p-value), and interannual anomalies, as CONUS-wide mosaiced products in a familiar and accessible file format (GeoTIFF), and a more familiar and web-ready projection (Web Mercator).
descript.purpose: These data were generated to overcome difficulties end users experience in using the MODIS Land Cover Dynamics product to obtain land surface phenology variables. These data are useful for a wide variety of ecological and climatological investigations, as well as modeling exercises.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: Data are provided as-is. No logical accuracy tests are performed beyond that done by the original data publishers.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.title: MCD12Q2 MODIS Land Cover Dynamics Product

srcinfo.srccontr: Annual phenometrics from first vegetation cycle

procstep.procdesc: All processing steps performed on individual MODIS tiles
Assemble time series of first vegetation cycle MCD12Q2 Collection 6 phenometrics (MidGreenup, MidGreendown, EVIarea) for 2001-2016
Convert date phenometrics (MidGreenup and MidGreendown) to DOY by subtracting days since 1-1-1970 for each product year
Omit missing values and compute median, median absolute deviation (R base), and Theil-Sen slope magnitude and p-value (R mblm package). Screen slopes where p > 0.05 (NoData)
Mosaic all MODIS tiles intersecting CONUS
Reproject from MODIS sinusoidal to NAD83 lat/long using gdalwarp with average resampling, set output NoData value of -9999, crop to CONUS outline

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Magnitude of significant (p = 0.05) Theil-Sen slopes of EVIarea phenometric from first MCD12Q2 layer

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.

distinfo.distliab: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data.
